Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text dealing with cession of land: on recto 4 ll., on verso names of 16 witnesses (nearly all different from those of P BM EA 10463). Dated year 12 Tybi of Ptolemy IV Philopator. The Greek Nikon called Petekhonsis son of Athenion cedes land on west bank at Thebes to the man of Philae Thoteus son of Psenminis. Scribe Khensthotes son of Horos. This is the bill of cession of the bill of sale P BM EA 10463. Cut in 3 sections and mounted in 3 frames.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.67-9, pl.56-7)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (8517) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/8517)
